timeline.message:
[miio] compiler warnings & spotbugs cleanup

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

timeline.bodyText: If these aren't supposed to be mutable you should return a Collections.emptyList() instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: This Gson instance should be reused, but I guess you can do that in another PR.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Thanks, moved it so it is reused indeed.
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        this.miIoDiscoveryJob = scheduler.scheduleWithFixedDelay(() -> discover(), 0, SEARCH_INTERVAL,
          
          
            
                        this.miIoDiscoveryJob = scheduler.scheduleWithFixedDelay(this::discover, 0, SEARCH_INTERVAL,
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: thanks. updated it to your suggestion
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.bodyText: I don't think you should grab the configuration until the handler is initialized, especially since configurations can change.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText: :-) good catch... was doing bit trail & error testing.. seems I did not change this one back.
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.bodyText: You can reuse threads like this?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Not 100% sure. I changed it to be sure.
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.message:
[miio] processing changes based on feedback

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

[miio] processing changes based on feedback

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

timeline.bodyText: too many conditional operators and ":" mixed with :. Can you make this more readable?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I improved this now. I think it is more clear
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.bodyText: Why can't this be created in the constructor? That way you can make the network field non-null and final.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: yes, that's a good way to solve it. Done.
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.bodyText: If you create a new thread isn't it still supposed to be started here? right now you are starting the thread in the constructor (and elsewhere maybe, I didn't check too thoroughly).
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: looks like a good place to use a switch statement.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: yes, that makes the code cleaner... done
replies.author: marcelrv

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Any specific exceptions you are trying to catch? If so please list them instead of catching a generic exception.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
There were various updating issues (e.g. conversion issues, colors not updating ell etc)
There should be no particular errors cuurently known to happen here
replies.author: marcelrv

replies.bodyText: leave as is for now then
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Why was this made a field?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
Indeed... Not really for this PR... For the next one...
I extracted these changes from the upcoming big pr to separate these many cleanup changes from the real functionality changes.
